securitygame

Class AttackerHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • securitygame.AttackerHelper

  • public class AttackerHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Auxiliary class for creating and parsing .attack files. Attacker will use the three parameter constructor and combination of the two attack methods and the four probe methods to generate an .attack file. Have Attacker remember to call close() when finished for safety. Game Master will use the two parameter constructor for parsing original network and attacker file to generate the attacker's visible network and history. Actions deemed invalid will be charged the Parameters.INVALID_RATE value.

      AttackerHelper(java.lang.String attackerName, java.lang.String graphFile)
      Constructor used by GameMaster to initialize a new visibility graph based on the attacker's visibility of the graph.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttackerHelper

        public AttackerHelper(Network network,
              java.lang.String graphFile,
              java.lang.String attackerName)
        Constructor used by Attacker to initialize visibility file and keep track of attacker history.
        Parameters:
        network - Graph being secured given a budget
        graphFile - Contains original name of graph i.e. "1" for 1.graph
        attackerName - Name of defender will be prepended to attacker file i.e. "allinners" for allinners-1.attack

      • AttackerHelper

        public AttackerHelper(java.lang.String attackerName,
              java.lang.String graphFile)
        Constructor used by GameMaster to initialize a new visibility graph based on the attacker's visibility of the graph.
        Parameters:
        attackerName - Name of attacker prepended to an .attack file i.e. "allinners" for allinners-1.attack
        graphFile - Contains original name of graph i.e. "1" for 1.graph

        public void strengthen(int id)
        Adds 1 to a node security value if the node is not public or not already at maximum security.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the node being strengthened

      • firewall

        public void firewall(int id1,
            int id2)
        Removes the edge between two nodes. Will not remove if doing so will isolate a node. Will not remove if there is no edge to remove.
        Parameters:
        id1 - First node's id
        id2 - Second node's id

      • honeypot

        public void honeypot(int sv,
            int pv,
            int[] newNeighbors)
        Adds a honeypot node to the graph if possible. Otherwise charges an invalid.
        Parameters:
        sv - Security Value for the honeypot
        pv - Point Value for the honeypot
        newNeighbors - Array of Node ID's specifying which nodes to connect the honeypot to
